item.title: Compile help (Ill Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @Gamerstips Gamerstips
item.description:
@Gamerstips wrote:

Its a command from Silab

[code]}
if(command.startsWith(“setsay”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“dr pepper”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“pepsi”)))
{
String setMsg = command.substring(7);
forceMsg = setMsg;
sM(“Your message has now been set to '”+forceMsg+"’");

}[/code]

if (command.startsWith("say") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("dr pepper") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("pepsi"))) { if(forceMsg != null) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(4); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.forceMsg = forceMsg; p.mustsay = 1; sM("Now making the player say : '"+forceMsg+"'."); } else { sM("That name does not exist, or they are not online."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Try entering a name you want to tele to you..."); } } else if(forceMsg == null) { sM("Please use ::setsay (message here) to set the message."); } }

[code]public void completeSay() {
txt4 = forceMsg;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
//sM(“Completed Say.”);
}

public void say(String msg){
txt4 = msg;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
updateRequired = true;
}[/code]

item.title: Compile help (Ill Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @_Rune_Realm ~Rune Realm
item.description:
@_Rune_Realm wrote:

Since mustsay is nested inside another method, you can’t declare it as public, nor private etc.

Just Change

public int mustsay = 0;

to

int mustsay = 0;

Edit: Now that I look at the whole code, it doesn’t make sense…

public String forceMsg; <----------------I Placed It Here { public int mustsay = 0; }

If it’s a string method, it is supposed to return a String (you’ll get an error if you don’t).
Also, you need to change ; into ()

Read full topic

item.description:
@Gamerstips wrote:

Sorry if im spamming, but i have this anoying error

I tried everything to fix it, but please help

I used google, and mopar search bar, and nothing came up

Ill Rep++ if you help me, and it works

(Im using DeltaScape)

Heres compile error…

client.java:33: illegal start of expression public int mustsay = 0; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Heres code…

public String forceMsg; { public int mustsay = 0; }

Heres were i placed it…

[code]/*

  • Client.java
  • Created by DdsSpeced
  •  Heavily modified by GamersTips.

*/

//2400,4446

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public int[] lowTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1153 };
public int[] mediumTask = { 87, 100, 19, 1267, 117, 78, 941, 1338, 912, 913, 914, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 };
public int[] highTask = { 1627, 181, 90, 112, 117, 78, 1183, 941, 2881, 2882, 2883, 2591, 2604, 2610, 1153, 1154 };
public int taskID = -1;
public int taskAmount = -1;

public String forceMsg; <----------------I Placed It Here
{
public int mustsay = 0;
}
public int randomLowTask() 
{
	return lowTask[(int) (Math.random() * lowTask.length)];
}

public int randomMediumTask() 
{
	return mediumTask[(int) (Math.random() * mediumTask.length)];
}

public int randomHighTask() 
{
	return highTask[(int) (Math.random() * highTask.length)];
}

public void slayerTalk() 
{[/code]

Any one know what i did wrong? Ill Rep++
